item.question: Which of the following greetings is used in the conversation?
item.choice: Good morning to you, too. - c
item.hint: The conversation takes place in the morning.
item.feedback: Correct. The soldier says, Maayong buntag (Good morning), and the Cebuano speaker replies in turn, Maayong buntag sab nimo (Good morning to you, too.)

item.question: Which of the following phrases does the Cebuano speaker use in the conversation?
item.hint: The Cebuano speaker uses palihog (please) in all of his statements in the conversation.
item.feedback: Correct. The Cebuano speaker says, Huwat palihog (Please wait), and then, Sulod palihog (Please come in).

item.question: Which of the following questions does the soldier ask in the interview?
item.hint: The soldier does not ask, Insakto ba ni?
item.feedback: Correct. The soldier uses these questions in the interview.

item.question: Which of the following food/beverage items are mentioned in the conversation?
item.hint: The term prutas is not used in the conversation.
item.feedback: Correct. The soldier and Cebuano speaker mention pork (baboy), chicken (manok), and coffee (kape).

item.question: Which of the following languages are mentioned in the conversation?
item.hint: The soldier is looking for someone who can speak both Cebuano and English.
item.feedback: Correct. Cebuano (Bisaya or Binisaya) and English (Ingles) are mentioned in the conversation.
